show off.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to try to make people admire your abilities, achievements, or possessions – used to show disapproval
show off.translation[0].definitions[0].e: He couldn’t resist showing off on the tennis court.
show off.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to show something to a lot of people because you are very proud of it
show off.translation[0].definitions[1].e: a picture of the restaurant’s owners showing off their award
show off.translation[0].definitions[2].d: if one thing shows off something else, it makes the other thing look especially attractive
show off.translation[0].definitions[2].e: The white dress showed off her dark skin beautifully.
show off.translation[1].definitions[0].d: someone who always tries to show how clever or skilled they are so that other people will admire them – often used to show disapproval
show off.translation[1].definitions[0].e: She’s a bit of a show-off.
